column4: doesn't look like anything there applies. the nvidia driver isn't loading
although it says it is in the hardware manager
any output from glxinfo ?
looks like a mis-configured /etc/X11/xorg.conf, hardy has a newer xorg and things have changed a bit .. could you pastebin that xorg.conf please ?
do you have nvidia-settings package installed ?
did you try the envyng-gtk drivers ?

well, i can't state that it's bullet-proof, but couldn't hurt to re-install and see what gives i suppose, since your system is crippled as it is right now .. re-installing that solved my xorg problems though, running smoothly ever since
hehe, yep, take the necessary backup precautions .. and use xorg-edit package to "test-drive" before committing ;)
any guidance from the /var/log/Xorg.0.log btw ?
ok great, i'll look and report back
looks clean allright ... one of those harder nuts to crack it seems
yep, the display 0.0 bit is the only thing to go on i suppose, weird
no it's a syntax thing that double O notation
i'm gonna take a precise look at my xorg.conf, back in a sec, just want to check something display-settings wise
what is the busid in your xorg.conf for the device section ?
that could be a problem .. i'll add something to your pastebin okay, it's worth a shot
added a one-liner, line 88
that sound be the same sequence of numbers as generated by the output of 'lspci'
*should, sound is working i hop ;)
too bad .. annoying
that is a tough one indeed .. although I didn't catch any mode lines in your xorg.conf neither ... taking a second look as we type ..
are you running a twinview xinerama set-up as your xorg.conf suggests ?
the only thing i can come up with is the somewhat unfamiliar *0 "Screen0" 0 0* bit on line 3, anyone around that can translate that into human speak for jessika ?
: never used a twinview setup like yours .. maybe someone who has can assist you
